title: Alta Luna 2015 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)
description: Scents of white spring flower and orchard fruit lead the nose on this lively white. The fresh, easy-drinking palate offers ripe green apple, peach and a juicy citrus note alongside tangy acidity.

title: Andrew Murray 2014 Enchante Curtis Vineyard White (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This blend of 55% Roussanne and 45% Grenache Blanc offers broad aromas of cooked apples, honeydew melon and peach custard. The palate is tighter, with seared green apples, lemon rind and yellow grapefruit zest, then slowly opens more tropically, with banana elements. This is a full-bodied white wine.

title: Andriano 2011 Tor di Lupo Riserva Lagrein (Alto Adige)
description: Dark berry, cocoa and leather aromas come into play on this hearty red. The chewy palate delivers mature black cherry, black currant, espresso and a hint of almond alongside solid tannins. Drink though 2018.

title: Artesa 2014 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Aged both in French oak and stainless steel, this entry-level white is creamy in texture with a taste of lemon cream pie and vanilla swirls, the tannins tight and the oak present, though cradling. Fresh and fruity, this is a food-friendly, approachable wine.

title: Bench 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This is a soft, well-integrated wine with a full-throttle backbone of cedar and cranberry that drinks easily and is ready for the table. Priced attractively, it offers value for the quality and broad appeal.

title: Binomio 2013 Superiore  (Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo)
description: Fresh and fragrant, this straightforward wine has aromas and flavors of wild cherry, strawberry and a hint of cake spice. It's bright and easygoing, with vibrant acidity that gives it clean, quenching finish.

title: Bodega Chacra 2014 Barda Pinot Noir (Patagonia)
description: Aromas of Christmas spice, black cherry and latex feed into a fresh, juicy palate with sharp acidity. Pie cherry and red plum flavors finish raw in feel and peppery in flavor. This is all about chop, chop, chop.

title: Domaine la Colombe 2015 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
description: This is an immediately attractive, fresh wine with red-currant and clementine-zest flavors. With its light, dancing character, it jumps out of the glass, full of fruit and with a delicious refreshing aftertaste.

title: Matrix 2013 Reserve Matrix Estate Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Juicy strawberry jam and dried herb combine for a forceful attack of bold, concentrated flavor and robust body, the wine textured in dusty tannin.

title: Millbrook 2013 Castle Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Hudson River Region)
description: Sun-ripened pineapple, mango and honey burst from the nose of this plush, fruit-forward wine. The palate feels creamy and dense, but the finish is brightened by crisp edges of lemon and lime acidity.

title: Joyce 2014 Trio Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Light and fresh on the nose, this twist-top bottling shows hibiscus, strawberry, chipped slate, a touch of clove and crushed star anise on the nose. The palate shows more slate as well as ripe raspberry, cinnamon and sagebrush.

title: J. Bookwalter 2015 Old Vine Willard Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Yakima Valley)
description: Aged in a mixture of concrete and stainless steel, this wine offers notes of melon, canteloupe and spice that intrigue. The just off-dry flavors are well balanced, possessing a textured feel.

title: St. Francis 2013 Merlot (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a well-made, larger-production offering of the variety that's appealingly round, soft and juicy, with a luxuriousness to the texture on the palate, generously surrounded in a big-bodied style of black cherry and vanilla.

title: Pelassa 2015 San Vito  (Roero)
description: Delicately fragrant, this offers scents of citrus blossom, white wild flower and yellow stone fruit. The soft, round palate presents creamy peach, nectarine, white almond and a hint of mineral alongside fresh acidity.

title: Patterson 2015 Melange Blanc White (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This blend of Chardonnay (44%), Viognier (39%) and Roussanne (17%) has surprisingly light aromas of melon, peach and straw leading to full-feeling, tingly stone-fruit flavors. It wants more aromatically but the palate delivers the enjoyment.

title: Pievalta 2014  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore
description: Delicately scented, this opens with subtle aromas of yellow spring flower and a whiff of citrus. The vibrant palate offers crisp Golden Delicious apple, grapefruit and mineral alongside zesty acidity. A delicate note of white almond signals the finish.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

title: Pondera 2012 SVS Number Two Stillwater Creek Vineyard Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This blend is principally Cabernet Sauvignon (48%), Cabernet Franc (23%) and Merlot (20%), with the balance Petit Verdot and Malbec. Appealing aromas of toast, barrel spice, vanilla, black cherry and herb lead to tart red- and black-fruit flavors that flow down the middle of the palate, with lightly grainy tannins supporting them.
designation: SVS Number Two Stillwater Creek Vineyard

title: Viluko 2012 Split Rock Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: This medium-bodied, affordably priced wine offers a wealth of juicy red fruit with soft layers of tannin. It was aged in unobtrusive oak, 25% of it new.

title: Tessari 2012 Tre Colli  (Recioto di Soave)
description: Delicate aromas of white flowers, dried fruit and a whiff of cake spice come together on this medium-bodied dessert wine. Made with 100% Garganega, the round palate offers mature apricot, cinnamon and touch of pine nut.

title: Nicholson Ranch 2013 Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Cherry-vanilla and cola provide a voluptuous, full-bodied outline for this estate-grown wine, given 20 months in French oak, one-quarter of it new.

title: Nielson by Byron 2014 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Fleshy fruits of white peach and guava and fragrant white flowers trend tropical on the nose of this bottling, but are cut by green apple and citrus skin flavors. The palate is broad with guava cream, apple blossoms, mango and lime chiffon flavors. Quite tasty, but very tropical.

title: Winzerkeller Andau 2015 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)
description: Hints of pear and white pepper are carried on a waft of zesty citrus. The palate is crisp, superclean and very juicy. It slips down far too easily and conjures up whole clouds of green and yellow pears. Drink soon.

title: Larner 2015 Rosé (Ballard Canyon)
description: Peach skins, red apple and a touch of slate and iron show on the nose of this rose, which is light in the glass with a tan shade of pink. The flavors are quite light with red apple and nectarine skin, framed by a steely minerality.

title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2015 Cuvée G Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: A blend of Syrah and Cinsault gives this wine that has some structure as well plenty of perfumed fruit. Lively and fruity, it revels in its crisp, open red-currant flavors. The wine will make a fine apéritif.

title: Geyser Peak 2013 Pluto's Fury Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a softly layered wine with just the right amount of tension to give credence to a lifted minerality, accented by well-crafted clove and baked strawberry. The finish is spicy in more clove and nutmeg.

title: Kunde 2012 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Strawberry and red currant complement deeper, more savory aspects of cedar and gun smoke in this thick, full-bodied and concentrated reserve-level wine, accented in bitter, black tea.

title: Lagoon Hill 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)
description: This wine is weightier than expected, with a broad, round, soft mouthfeel that delivers subtle notes of green fig and citrus. There's a hint of wet stone as well, which adds a bit of interest.

title: Honor Winery 2014 Klopp Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From the site made famous by Merry Edwards along the appellation's Laguna Ridge, this wine envelops dark cherry, strawberry and herb flavors along a brooding, softly velvet and voluptuously body, weighted slightly in toasted oak and firm tannin.

title: Hugl-Wimmer 2015 Hugl Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: Green pear and balm-like hints of aloe vera appear first on the palate then are followed by softly spiced and slightly peppery citrus notes that also provide some welcomed texture. A lovely, easy-drinking Grüner.

title: Zantho 2015 Welschriesling (Burgenland)
description: Subdued citrus and crunchy apple unite in the fresh, easy-drinking palate that majors on the refreshing, appetizing aromas of Granny Smith apple with all their attendant, crisp freshness. Drink soon—possibly at a party where light, easy wine makes conversation and laughter flow. The wonderfully clean finish makes you want more.
